image.altText: Football specatators watch a game on a foggy day

props.synopsis: In the Yarriambiack Shire, 350 kilometres from Melbourne in Victoria's rural north-west, virtually all of the towns are shrinking.

title.children: A quarter of this town's population has vanished. Experts say that could be terminal

image.altText: Protesters stand by a beach promenade, waving Palestinian flags

props.synopsis: Protesters are gathering for dozens of pro-Palestinian demonstrations set to go ahead across the country, as a tentative ceasefire between Israel and Hamas continues. Follow live.Â

title.children: Protesters gather for pro-Palestinian rallies across Australia

image.altText: A young girl wearing a blue uniform smiles as she sits at a desk in a classroom.

props.synopsis: The suspected murder-suicide of a mother and her daughter has raised serious questions about whether there were missed opportunities to intervene.

title.children: Clementine was a 'future leader'. Her mother is suspected of taking her life

image.altText: Chaz Mostert of Walkinshaw Andretti United watches on from pit lane

props.synopsis: Chaz Mostert's hopes of winning the Bathurst 1000 ended before the halfway mark at Mount Panorama, with the Ford driver joining fans for a beer as his car was being towed off the circuit. Follow live.

title.children: Mostert cracks a beer with Bathurst 1000 fans while car is towed off

image.altText: three men sitting at a desk

props.synopsis: Jared Kushner was a familiar face sitting beside Israelâs PM as a first-phase peace agreement was finalised. According to senior US officials, it was because he was a key player in closing the deal.

image.altText: A man with short, grey hair holds his hands in a prayer gesture while standing at a lectern flanked by a man and a woman.

props.synopsis: Thousands of Israelis have gathered in Tel Aviv, where US envoy Steve Witkoff spoke to the crowd in anticipation of the release of the remaining hostages in Gaza.

title.children: Netanyahu booed as US envoy Witkoff addresses massive rally in Tel Aviv

image.altText: Household grocery items including milk, toilet paper, instant coffee and eggs.

props.synopsis: Last month, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese invited Emirati hypermarket chain LuLu Group to compete with Coles and Woolworths for market share. But some retail experts say entry into Australia's supermarket sector isn't so simple. Â

title.children: A new supermarket's been invited to Australia. Here's how its prices stack up

image.altText: Diane Keaton, wearing tinted glasses and black and white chequed top and scarf, smiles in a head-and-shouloder shot

props.synopsis: The unexpected news of Keaton's passing has been met with shock around the world, with stars remembering their time with the actor.

title.children: 'One of the greatest': Hollywood pays tribute to Diane Keaton who has died at 79

image.altText: A man and woman stand on a rooftop.

props.synopsis: With a career beginning in the late 1970s, Diane Keaton would star in more than 100 films and earn several Oscar nods.

title.children: Diane Keaton was a charming, kooky on-screen force. Here's her best films

image.altText: A man in a Richmond AFL jumper, with his face painted yellow and black, looks into a mirror.

props.synopsis: Diehard Richmond fan "Tiger Shaun" says he's watched on in horror as gambling advertising and sponsorships have come to dominate football â and become a constant reminder of the addiction he has struggled with.

title.children: 'Gambling advertising needs to go, and it needs to go now': Footy fan's plea

image.altText: A group of people stand in darkness, holding candles.

props.synopsis: Authorities in the US say 16 people died in a massive explosion at a Tennessee munitions facility that has left a shocked community in mourning.

title.children: Community mourns as death toll from US munitions plant blast revised

image.altText: family on the beach

props.synopsis: Buyers who bought off-the-plan at a Gold Coast housing development years ago weren't just purchasing a home â they were purchasing a dream. Now, the developer is trying to cancel their contracts, but they don't want to accept that lying down.

title.children: Buyers priced out of market as developer finds sunset clause loophole

image.altText: Russian President Vladimir Putin and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi hug.

props.synopsis: Regardless of its historical defence ties to Russia, or its economic reliance on the United States, India is politically non-monogamous.

title.children: Trump points finger at Putin as US relationship with India falters

image.altText: Ian Watkins is jailed for 35 years for child sex offences.

image.altText: An outback roadway is severely broken into chunks, with dirt strewn over sections. An excavator works in the background.

props.synopsis: Australia's largest shire says it needs state and federal support to repair roads damaged during a cyclone, which provide a "lifeline" to remote communities.Â

title.children: Pleading for help to repair 'atrocious' roads months after cyclone

image.altText: A man in a boat holding up a fish he caught.

props.synopsis: The political party governing the Northern Territory announces a new president, just days after the opposition welcomed a former chief minister into its own leadership role.Â

title.children: Fishing fanatic and long-time CLP supporter to lead as party president

image.altText: A woman is obscured by three overpacked tubs she is holding in front of her in a white room.

props.synopsis: Our emotional attachment to objects can make spring cleaning hard. So is it worth the effort?

title.children: Decluttering to 'spark joy'? Here's why tidying up can be so hard

image.altText: A cat sitting on a woman's lap perched on the handlebars of a motorbike.

title.children: Move over muster dogs â there's a new cat in town

image.altText: Woman in dress puts arms around children and smiles at park table

props.synopsis: The Queensland Government will support at least 4,000 women return to work with grant program to help upskill, buy new tech and pay for childcare.

image.altText: A surf life saving red and yellow flag on the beach

props.synopsis: A record number of beaches in SA are set to have Surf Life Saving patrols seven days a week this summer, as the state grapples with its toxic algal bloom.

image.altText: A woman works on a wedding dress on a mannequin with wedding dresses on hangers behind her.

props.synopsis: Chinese Australian women are paying thousands of dollars to find love on matchmaking platforms in Australia, but behind the glossy promotions lies a different reality.

title.children: 'Why marry at all?' Woman upset at matchmaking service

image.altText: a composite image of a dry down paddock next to a full crop of canola in bloom.

props.synopsis: After months of dust and dry skies, farmers on South Australia's Limestone Coast have welcomed early spring rain and a promising season ahead. Â

title.children: Once parched and bare, these paddocks are now flourishing again

image.altText: an automated entry exit system display and a fingerprint scanner

props.synopsis: A new entry/exit system will require all non-European Union citizens to register their personal details, including fingerprints and facial images.

title.children: Travelling to Europe soon? You will be fingerprinted on arrival

image.altText: platypus swimming in water

props.synopsis: Almost 190 years on, in the place where Charles Darwin first spotted a platypus, the egg-laying mammal seems to have disappeared.

title.children: Platypus vanish from river where Charles Darwin pondered evolution

image.altText: Two women sit posing for the camera wearing floral shirts and smiling.

props.synopsis: The longest-running year 12 formal for First Nations people in New South Wales proves to be an incentive for students to complete their HSC.

title.children: Two aunties' idea for year 12 celebration thrives after almost two decades

image.altText: A dingo on K'gari (Fraser Island) on December 18.

title.children: Boy flown to hospital after dingo attack on K'gari

image.altText: Car registration papers with blacked-out sections.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's West Coast Council has blamed an "administrative error" for a week-long lapse in the registration for its entire fleet of vehicles, compromising insurance.

title.children: 'Administrative error' leads to council's unregistered vehicle fleet

image.altText: A film still of Nick Offerman, 55, with a closely shaved head and goatee, looking panicked behind the wheel of a car.

image.altText: An outline of a woman.

props.synopsis: From the Desert to the Seaside arts and music festival brings Western Australia's largest remote community of Bidyadanga together.

title.children: Music festival remote Indigenous community's biggest event in a decade

image.altText: girl outside hospital in wheelchair, with woman kneeling down and kelpie dog.
